verses.text: And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,
Sanctify unto me all the firstborn , whatsoever openeth the womb among the children of Israel , \add both\add* of man and of beast : it \add is\add* mine. \p

¶ And Moses said unto the people , Remember this day , in which ye came out from Egypt , out of the house of bondage ; for by strength of hand the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* brought you out from this \add place:\add* there shall no leavened bread be eaten.\f + \fr 13.3 \ft bondage: Heb. servants\f*
This day came ye out in the month Abib. \p

¶ And it shall be when the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites , and the Hittites , and the Amorites , and the Hivites , and the Jebusites , which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey , that thou shalt keep this service in this month.
Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread , and in the seventh day \add shall be\add* a feast to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days ; and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee in all thy quarters. \p
¶ And thou shalt shew thy son in that day , saying , \add This is done\add* because of that \add which\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* did unto me when I came forth out of Egypt.

And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand , and for a memorial between thine eyes , that the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* law may be in thy mouth : for with a strong hand hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* brought thee out of Egypt.
Thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in his season from year to year. \p
¶ And it shall be when the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites , as he sware unto thee and to thy fathers , and shall give it thee,

That thou shalt set apart unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* all that openeth the matrix , and every firstling that cometh of a beast which thou hast; the males \add shall be\add* the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 13.12  t set…: Heb. cause to pass over *

And every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb ; and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break his neck : and all the firstborn of man among thy children shalt thou redeem.\f + \fr 13.13 \ft lamb: or, kid\f* \p

¶ And it shall be when thy son asketh thee in time to come , saying , What \add is\add* this? that thou shalt say unto him, By strength of hand the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* brought us out from Egypt , from the house of bondage :\f + \fr 13.14 \ft in…: Heb. to morrow\f*

And it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go , that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt , both the firstborn of man , and the firstborn of beast : therefore I sacrifice to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* all that openeth the matrix , being males ; but all the firstborn of my children I redeem.
And it shall be for a token upon thine hand , and for frontlets between thine eyes : for by strength of hand the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* brought us forth out of Egypt. \p

¶ And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go , that God led them not \add through\add* the way of the land of the Philistines , although that \add was\add* near ; for God said , Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war , and they return to Egypt :

But God led the people about , \add through\add* the way of the wilderness of the Red sea : and the children of Israel went up harnessed out of the land of Egypt.\f + \fr 13.18 \ft harnessed: or, by five in a rank\f*
And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel , saying , God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you. \p
¶ And they took their journey from Succoth , and encamped in Etham , in the edge of the wilderness.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud , to lead them the way ; and by night in a pillar of fire , to give them light ; to go by day and night :
He took not away the pillar of the cloud by day , nor the pillar of fire by night , \add from\add* before the people.
